name: 5.26 "I Do and Adieu" Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Whose final appearance as a cast member was in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Shelley Long.

	Shelley Long decided after five years to leave the show. Shelley Long said on "The Phil Donahue Show" that she left to devote more time to her family and to work on movies. However, it was also rumored by even other cast members that she simply didn't get along with the other cast members.

questions.text: Who from the first episode came to Cheers to see Diane?
questions.explanation:
Sumner Sloan.

	Sloan came to tell Diane some news that he had. Diane was not particularly thrilled to see him, but was happy about the news.

questions.text: What did Diane have a chance to be?
questions.explanation:
a published author.

	Salone told her that he sent her transcript to some publishers. They wanted to publish her novel and she had six months to finish it.

questions.text: What was Diane holding as the man left?
questions.explanation:
the 8-ball.

	While the 8-ball is a ball used in playing pool it also signifies an important decision has to be made. This comes from the fact that in pool all the other balls are played before the 8-ball is played.

questions.text: Where did Sam say he wanted to go?
questions.explanation:
The Orient.

	He said he never specifically said he wanted to go to the Orient but Diane knew he loved Chinese food. He was trying to convince her to finish her novel.

questions.text: Who couldn't get up to get the door?
questions.explanation:
Old Sam.

	The doorbell rang and Old Sam said, "I'll get it." Then he couldn't get up and said, "Maybe you'd better do it."

questions.text: How many times a night did Old Norm say he was up?
questions.explanation:
30.

	That was Norm's reply when asked "What's up Norm?" They all yelled "Norm!" when he entered Old Sam and Old Diane's house just like they always did at Cheers.

questions.text: Who owned Cheers after Sam retired?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	Woody changed the name to "Woody's Bar". Norm said that Woody's family all got together at the end of the night and added up the receipts on their fingers and toes.

questions.text: Who cried at Sam and Diane's wedding?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Most people cry at weddings because they are happy. Carla was not happy at all that Sam was marrying Diane. She was very happy when the wedding didn't take place.

questions.text: What was Sam's final words to the character that was leaving the show?
questions.explanation:
"Have a good life."

	Diane told Sam she'd be back in six months. After she left, knowing she wouldn't be back, he said "Have a good life." This was a good ending since in reality Shelly Long had left the show.
